77c4be60e6151163358a13e9a7ab83b8 (17:40): where should custom namespaces be stored ?
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (17:40): schnoodle? stored?
77c4be60e6151163358a13e9a7ab83b8 (17:42): directory wise
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (17:43): where ever you think is right
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (17:43): at work we have the company name as the root namespace ... at home i tend to just use the app name
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (17:44): sometimes i dont even have a root namespace for it all ... just have it loose
77c4be60e6151163358a13e9a7ab83b8 (17:44): yes but you have a company name, then where do you save that to
77c4be60e6151163358a13e9a7ab83b8 (17:45): there has to be a standard
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (17:45): you dont "save it"
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (17:45): well you can set the root namespace in the project properties acctually
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (17:45): so you dont have to type it in each time
78dbc21d2902c96d3067f18f609ca04c (17:46): put when you make a class it should be in a namespace my.namespace.something{}
77c4be60e6151163358a13e9a7ab83b8 (17:47): then if you start a new project and do using mynamespace; class NewProject { }
77c4be60e6151163358a13e9a7ab83b8 (17:47): will it pick up the namespace ?

efcb1cfe5b4d1032c158415eda536f19 (18:31): im using ArrayList sort al.Sort(); how can i have it do a reverse sort?
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:32): reverse the comparer
efcb1cfe5b4d1032c158415eda536f19 (18:32): how i do that >.<
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:32): if your comparer was a > b, so a < b
efcb1cfe5b4d1032c158415eda536f19 (18:32): oh okay thanks let me try that
efcb1cfe5b4d1032c158415eda536f19 (18:33): the things in the al are strings but lemme try brb
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:34): well something like al.Sort(delegate(string a, string b) { return a.CompareTo(b); } );
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:34): if you want it reversed, to b.CompareTo(a)

efcb1cfe5b4d1032c158415eda536f19 (18:39): Argument '1': cannot convert from 'anonymous method' to 'System.Collections.ICompare'
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (18:44): anyone know why remote desktop would limit the desktop remoted to to 16bit color? i NEED 24bit
4eebb990e98982ce6579a9c1b716e44d (18:47): because your options are set to 16bit
4eebb990e98982ce6579a9c1b716e44d (18:47): or your connecting to a windows 2000 box
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (18:48): neither of those are true
4eebb990e98982ce6579a9c1b716e44d (18:48): which does not have 24bit color
4eebb990e98982ce6579a9c1b716e44d (18:48): then something you are doing is fubar
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (18:48): set remote desktop options on the machine connecting to 24bit, and the machine i'm connecting to is win2k3
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (18:48): err it might be xp....
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (18:49): yeah, i think it's xp... (like it matters anyway)
06d9f5004faf7205aca782823f1c53be (18:50): is there anything else that might limit the color depth?
4eebb990e98982ce6579a9c1b716e44d (18:50): does the host support 24 bit color locally?
4eebb990e98982ce6579a9c1b716e44d (18:50): if not that could be another reason
